page.title: 06GRAFFHAM ARCHIVES
page.content: The society members are people who are interested in the preservation of records and artefacts which might have been thrown away. They get things from people who live in Graffham and someone who lives in Fittleworth. They have old pictures, books, letters and even a shepherd's smock. The oldest items are the photocopies of maps and photographs. It is run by a committee who all like historical things. They think that these things must be kept safely so they do not get broken or stolen. The idea for the need for such a club was first seen by an old headmistress of the school.
